Description: Sherd (base). With inscription,rosette and meander. Made of cobalt painted and green glazed, crackled pottery (white-buff).
Curator's comments: On pottery with this signature: Y. Kanda, "Revisiting the So-called Ghaybī Workshop: Toward a History of Burjī Mamluk Ceramics", Orient 52 (2017) 39-57
Bibliographic references: Wallis 1891 / Persian Ceramic Art Belonging to Mr F DuCane Godman, FRS: The Thirteenth Century Lustred Vases (Appendix pl.vii.10)
Gibbs 1994 / Mamluk Underglaze-Decorated Wares: Some Evidence from Fustat (fig.75)
